proper noun.description: A port in southeastern Spain; population 210,376 (2008). Originally named Mastia, it was refounded as Carthago Nova (New Carthage) by Hasdrubal in c.225 BC, as a base for the Carthaginian conquest of Spain.
A port, resort, and oil-refining center in northwestern Colombia, on the Caribbean Sea; population 885,400 (2005).
